definition: lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
(negative prefix)/not/no
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: The egghead in the university knows nothing about business.
sentences.chinese: 大學裏的書呆子對生意一竅不通。

sentences.english: You’re sort of missing the entire ‘advertising is lying’ concept, Harry.
sentences.chinese: 你對‘廣告就是謊言’這個概念根本一竅不通，哈利。

sentences.english: Suresh: I'm a geneticist . I wouldn't know the first thing about this.
sentences.chinese: 我是個遺傳學家，我對醫療這方面一竅不通。

sentences.english: You might be a great writer but terrible at design.
sentences.chinese: 你也許是個很棒的作家，但卻對設計一竅不通。

sentences.english: She offers up silly advice and is clueless about the latest fashion rage.
sentences.chinese: 她一無所知，老出餿主意，對流行時尚一竅不通。

sentences.english: It's no good talking to me about physics; it's a closed book to me.
sentences.chinese: 跟我談物理等於白說，我對它一竅不通。

sentences.english: He does not understand finance at all.
I'm afraid we do know nothing about the song - writing business.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我們對寫歌的生意一竅不通吧？

sentences.english: I was even metaphor sentences are all thumbs.
sentences.chinese: 我那是連比喻句都一竅不通。

sentences.english: But she's a horrible singer and dancer.
sentences.chinese: 但她對唱歌和跳舞實在是一竅不通。

sentences.english: He is utterly ignorant of staff [stave].
Obviously he knows nothing about technology." –Jimmy Kimmel
sentences.chinese: 很顯然，他對科技一竅不通。
我也對貼牆紙一竅不通。

sentences.english: She is just a pseud ; she knows nothing about art really.
sentences.chinese: 她不過是假稱內行罷了，實際上對藝術一竅不通。

sentences.english: I did not know Cantonese at all and knew Mandarin only a little.
sentences.chinese: 廣東話我一竅不通，中文也只識得少許。

sentences.english: She tried to explain her theories about modern poetry but it was Greek to me.
sentences.chinese: 她試圖闡述她的現代詩歌理論，但我卻一竅不通。

definition: to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
profound mystery
layman
to have no sense of shame/brazen
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
unscrupulous businessperson/profiteer/philistine
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
mouth like a torrent (idiom)/eloquent/glib/voluble/have the gift of the gab
overbearing/arrogant bully
keyboard instrument (piano, organ etc)
old school/conservative faction
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to be at a loss for words/speechless
